original: tu ston pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: tu ston pa ma yin nam /

original: de ni de lta ba yin te /

translated: because the conviction in selflessness arises without the conception of distinctions in the supramundane and mundane contexts.

analyzed: pa tha dad par rtogs pa med pa can du 'byung ba kho na'o //

original: 'di ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa na yod pa'i 'jig rten pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa na yod pa'i 'jig rten pa yin no //
translated: This is the mundane perfection of wisdom on the stage of action in faith.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pas ni shes rab mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i sgo nas gzhung rgyas pa la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa don la gzhol ba'i sems dang ldan pa tshig gis don nyung shas shig gi rjes su 'brangs te 'gro ba mtha' dag bdag med par

analyzed: de lta bas na tshig 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brjod par @118b bya ba yin no //

analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa ni dngos su dgos pa yin no //

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas re zhig sems can du lta ba bdag gis 'di bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa bdag dang gzhan du shes pa'i bdag nyid dge ba dang cig shos su tha snyad gdags pa'i rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa de yang gnyen
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas re zhig sems can du lta ba bdag gis 'di bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa bdag dang gzhan du shes pa'i bdag nyid dge ba dang cig shos su tha snyad gdags pa'i rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa de yang gnyen
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva first establishes the view of sentient beings, thinking, ‚ÄúI will accomplish this,‚Äù and that which is designated as virtuous or otherwise, which is the nature of knowing self and other.

original: po'i sgo nas bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: po'i sgo nas bsal bar bya'o //
translated: That is also removed by means of its antidote.

original: de ma gsal na mi sdug pa la sogs par mos pa yid la byed pa tsam gyis ni de la rag las te 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rigs gtan nas bsal bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma gsal na mi sdug pa la sogs par mos pa yid la byed pa tsam gyis ni de la rag las te 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rigs gtan nas bsal bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is not removed, it is said that one cannot completely remove the type of affliction that arises in dependence on it, merely by attending to repulsiveness and so on.üîΩMoreover, it is said:

original: gzhan yang / ting 'dzin 'jig rten na ni sgom mod kyi //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ting 'dzin 'jig rten na ni sgom mod kyi //
translated: Though concentration is cultivated in the world,

original: de yis bdag gi 'jig rten mi 'jig na //
analyzed: de yis bdag gi 'jig rten mi 'jig na //
translated: it does not destroy the world of the self.

original: de la nyon mongs yang rab 'khrugs 'gyur te //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs yang rab 'khrugs 'gyur te //
translated: Afflictions are greatly disturbed by it,

original: lhag spyod 'dir ni ting 'dzin bsgom pa bzhin //üîΩzhes gang gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: lhag spyod 'dir ni ting 'dzin bsgom pa bzhin //üîΩzhes gang gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: like Udraka‚Äôs cultivation of concentration here.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po ni bdag med pa'i lta ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po ni bdag med pa'i lta ba yin te /
translated: The view of self is the antidote to the view of self.

original: de ni bdag med pa la sogs pa'i spyod yul can yin pa nyid kyi de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bdag med pa la sogs pa'i spyod yul can yin pa nyid kyi de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the antidote to the view of self because it is the object of the view of selflessness, etc., and it is incompatible with the view of self.

original: gal te 'di gnyis phan tshun dmigs pa 'gal ba'i phyir 'gal bar 'dra ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'di gnyis phan tshun dmigs pa 'gal ba'i phyir 'gal bar 'dra ba ma yin nam /
translated: If these two are similar in that they are incompatible because they are mutually non-apprehensible,

original: 'di la lhag pa ci zhig yod na des bdag med par lta ba kho na sems can du lta ba'i gnyen por bzhag @122a * //
analyzed: 'di la lhag pa ci zhig yod na des bdag med par lta ba kho na sems can du lta ba'i gnyen por bzhag @122a * //
translated: what is the difference between them that the view of selflessness alone is posited as the antidote to the view of sentient beings, etc.,

original: la 'di ni de'i gnyen po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: la 'di ni de'i gnyen po ma yin zhe na /
translated: but this is not the antidote to that?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: sems can la sogs par lta ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can la sogs par lta ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the view of sentient beings, etc., is not an object.

original: 'di ltar 'di'i yul gang zag la sogs pa'i rdzas phung po la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis kun brtags pa lta bu zhig yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'i yul gang zag la sogs pa'i rdzas phung po la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis kun brtags pa lta bu zhig yin nam /
translated: In this way, is the object of that view imagined to be something other than the aggregates, etc., the substance of the person, etc.,

original: phung po la sogs pa zhig yin par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa zhig yin par 'gyur grang /
translated: or is it the aggregates, etc.?

original: gang zag gi rdzas la dmigs pa nyid gcig yin na yang sems can du lta ba mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid dam rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid gcig yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gang zag gi rdzas la dmigs pa nyid gcig yin na yang sems can du lta ba mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid dam rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid gcig yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If the object of the substance of the person is the same, then the view of sentient beings would be the same as the nature of direct perception or inference.

original: de la re zhig 'di mngon sum ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'di mngon sum ni ma yin te /
translated: First, this is not direct perception,

original: sngon po la sogs par snang ba bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir dang yongs su mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par snang ba bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir dang yongs su mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not follow the eye and so on, like the appearance of blue and so on, and because it is not a completely clear aspect.

original: dbang po'i byed pa la mi ltos par skye ba'i shes pa mi gsal bar snang ba can ni mngon sum ma yin par 'os pa ma yin te de lta ma yin na shes pa thams cad mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa la mi ltos par skye ba'i shes pa mi gsal bar snang ba can ni mngon sum ma yin par 'os pa ma yin te de lta ma yin na shes pa thams cad mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not right that a consciousness that arises without depending on the function of the sense faculty and that appears unclearly is not direct perception, because if it were not so, it would follow that all consciousnesses would be direct perception.

original: 'di ni sngon po mthong ba na sngon por rtogs pa'i blo bzhin du bdag gzhan mthong ba'i rjes su 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sngon po mthong ba na sngon por rtogs pa'i blo bzhin du bdag gzhan mthong ba'i rjes su 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not even a nonconceptual direct perception, because it is a subsequent cognition that follows the perception of self and other, just like the cognition that understands blue when one sees blue.

original: lus la sogs pa kun du rig pa las ma gtogs par bdag gi rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa kun du rig pa las ma gtogs par bdag gi rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the self is not perceived apart from the awareness of the body and so on, it is not a nonconceptual perception of the self.

original: gal te 'di ni bdag gi lus la sogs pa yin no zhes tha dad par shes pa'i phyir tha dad par rab tu grub pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ni bdag gi lus la sogs pa yin no zhes tha dad par shes pa'i phyir tha dad par rab tu grub pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is established as different because it is known as different, as in ‚ÄúThis is my body and so on,‚Äù

original: ma yin te shes pa tsam 'jug pa la mngon sum gyi tha snyad mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma yin te shes pa tsam 'jug pa la mngon sum gyi tha snyad mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: that is not so, because it is impossible to call a mere engagement of consciousness direct perception.

original: de las gzhan pa las tha dad pa sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa yongs su gsal bar mthong ba la 'di ni ser po la sogs pa la tha dad pa'i yon tan yin no zhes bya bar shes pa ni mngon sum gyi tha snyad kyi yul canüîΩyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa las tha dad pa sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa yongs su gsal bar mthong ba la 'di ni ser po la sogs pa la tha dad pa'i yon tan yin no zhes bya bar shes pa ni mngon sum gyi tha snyad kyi yul canüîΩyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognition that sees the aspect of something different from that, such as blue, and the cognition that understands that it is a different quality from yellow and so on is the subject of the term direct perception.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: shes pa tsam mngon sum nyid yin na ni rtog pa thams cad mngon sum gyi tha snyad kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'am ma 'khrul ba cung zad kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa tsam mngon sum nyid yin na ni rtog pa thams cad mngon sum gyi tha snyad kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'am ma 'khrul ba cung zad kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: if mere consciousness were direct perception, then all conceptual consciousnesses would be direct perception, and there would be no error or non-error at all.

original: de lta bas na lus la sogs pa kun tu rig pa las bdag tha dad par ma grub na tha dad pa'i blo 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na lus la sogs pa kun tu rig pa las bdag tha dad par ma grub na tha dad pa'i blo 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if the self is not established as different from the awareness of the body, etc., the cognition of difference is erroneous.

original: 'dis ni bdag gis mthong ngo lta'o blta bar bya'o snyam du shes pa'i @122b mngon sum dus gsum gyi rjes su 'gro ba sgrub par byed pa yin pa yang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag gis mthong ngo lta'o blta bar bya'o snyam du shes pa'i @122b mngon sum dus gsum gyi rjes su 'gro ba sgrub par byed pa yin pa yang bsal ba yin te /
translated: This also eliminates the proof of the self‚Äôs existence as the subject of the direct perception of the cognition ‚ÄúI see,‚Äù ‚ÄúI hear,‚Äù ‚ÄúI will see.‚Äù

original: dus la sogs pas so sor nges par khyad par du byas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs las ma gtogs par rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid gcig po mi snang ba'i phyir dang / snang ba rnams kyang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus la sogs pas so sor nges par khyad par du byas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs las ma gtogs par rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid gcig po mi snang ba'i phyir dang / snang ba rnams kyang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, apart from the states of pleasure, etc., qualified by the distinctions of time, etc., no single self that is their substratum is perceived, and because the things that are perceived are not the self.

original: shes pa yod pa tsam la bdag tu shes pa yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa tsam la bdag tu shes pa yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Also, the cognition that merely exists as the self is not a valid cognition of direct perception.

original: rtags med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtags med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not inference because there is no reason.

original: don lkog tu gyur pa la rtags kyis skyed pa'i shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin na bsgrub par bya ba'i bdag la ni rtags cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: don lkog tu gyur pa la rtags kyis skyed pa'i shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin na bsgrub par bya ba'i bdag la ni rtags cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Inference is the cognition that is generated by a reason in regard to a hidden object. But there is not the slightest reason for the self that is to be proven.

original: gal te dran pa la sogs pa rtags yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te dran pa la sogs pa rtags yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that memory and so on are the reason, that is not so.

original: de dag bdag mngon sum du ma gyur pa dang 'brel ba mi rtag pa'i phyir dad tshad mas gnod pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag bdag mngon sum du ma gyur pa dang 'brel ba mi rtag pa'i phyir dad tshad mas gnod pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Because they are related to the self that is not directly perceptible, they are impermanent and because they are undermined by valid knowledge.

original: dran pa la sogs pa dang gis 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin rnams ni ngang gis mi 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid du kun brtags pa'i bdag dang de'i bdag nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa dang gis 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin rnams ni ngang gis mi 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid du kun brtags pa'i bdag dang de'i bdag nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that those things that are by nature subject to destruction, such as memory, are the self that is imagined to be by nature not subject to destruction, and that they are of the nature of the self.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i bdag nyid rnams kyang gcig pa nyid yin na ni tha dad pa cung zad kyang med pas 'gro ba mtha' dag tha dad pa dang tha dad ma yin pa'i tha snyad med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i bdag nyid rnams kyang gcig pa nyid yin na ni tha dad pa cung zad kyang med pas 'gro ba mtha' dag tha dad pa dang tha dad ma yin pa'i tha snyad med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If things that are mutually contradictory in nature were the same, then there would be no difference at all, and it follows that the whole of the world would be devoid of the conventions of difference and nondifference.

original: dran pa la sogs pa bdag gi 'bras bu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa bdag gi 'bras bu yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is memory, etc., the effect of the self,

original: rim gyis skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gyis skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises in sequence.

original: rgyu bdag rtag pa gcig pa'i ngo bo yin pas rim pa dang mi ldan pa la ni de tsam la rag las te 'byung ba'i 'bras bu rim can du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu bdag rtag pa gcig pa'i ngo bo yin pas rim pa dang mi ldan pa la ni de tsam la rag las te 'byung ba'i 'bras bu rim can du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the cause, the permanent, unitary self, is not endowed with sequence, it is not tenable that the effect that is dependent on it arises in sequence.

original: gal te nang gi bdag lhan cig byed par rim pa dang ldan pa nye ba la ltos nas rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la rim pa kho nas byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu rim can yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te nang gi bdag lhan cig byed par rim pa dang ldan pa nye ba la ltos nas rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la rim pa kho nas byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu rim can yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the internal self, which is endowed with sequence, produces its effect in sequence because it is dependent on the proximity of the cooperating conditions, that is not so.

original: rtag pa nyid kyis phan pa byar med pa ni de las gzhan pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis phan pa byar med pa ni de las gzhan pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is permanent, it is not useful, because it does not depend on anything else.

original: phan par bya ba nyid yid na yang phan pa ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de byas na bdag byas par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan par bya ba nyid yid na yang phan pa ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de byas na bdag byas par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is useful, then since the usefulness is not a different nature from it, it follows that when the usefulness is done, the self is done.

original: de lhan yang bdag rtag pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lhan yang bdag rtag pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But the self is not permanent.

original: phan pa bdag dang tha dad pa nyid gcig yin na ni dran pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'brel pa mi 'thad la thug pa med par yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan pa bdag dang tha dad pa nyid gcig yin na ni dran pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'brel pa mi 'thad la thug pa med par yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the usefulness is different from the self, then, like memory, it is not tenable that they are related, and it follows that there is an infinite regress.

original: @123a * // de lta bas na bdag phan pa zhes bya ba 'brel pa med pa dngos po gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa nye ba la ma ltos pa ni rim gyis byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir de tsam la rag las pa'i dran pa la sogs pa
analyzed: @123a * // de lta bas na bdag phan pa zhes bya ba 'brel pa med pa dngos po gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa nye ba la ma ltos pa ni rim gyis byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir de tsam la rag las pa'i dran pa la sogs pa
translated: Therefore, the so-called self is not related to anything, and the simultaneous assemblage of conditions that benefit other things is not dependent on it, because it is devoid of gradual activity.

original: cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore memory and so on that depend on it would arise simultaneously.

original: de lta na ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa'i rgyun med pas 'gro ba ma lus pa 'bad mi dgos par mya ngan las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa'i rgyun med pas 'gro ba ma lus pa 'bad mi dgos par mya ngan las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par thob par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, since there would be no continuum of faults such as attachment in the second moment and so on, all reincarnating beings would effortlessly attain the excellence of nirvana.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang bdag gis bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gtan pa ma yin pa de dag kyang cig car kho nar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang bdag gis bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gtan pa ma yin pa de dag kyang cig car kho nar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And since attachment and so on would also be generated by the self, they would occur simultaneously, since they are not determined to be otherwise.

original: de lta na yang bdag mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
translated: In that case, the self would be impermanent,

original: sngon dran pa la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i de 'byed pa skad cig ma phyin chad de mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon dran pa la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i de 'byed pa skad cig ma phyin chad de mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which generates memory and so on in the past would not generate it in the second moment and so on.

original: de'i tshe ni dngos po yang ma yin pa nyid de dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni dngos po yang ma yin pa nyid de dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, it would not be a thing because the definition of a thing is that it is able to perform a function.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs par snang ba phyi rol gyi gzugs nyid du don byed pa dang bral ba dag dngos po nyid du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dis ni phung po la sogs pa yang rtag pa'i phyogs nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs par snang ba phyi rol gyi gzugs nyid du don byed pa dang bral ba dag dngos po nyid du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro // 'dis ni phung po la sogs pa yang rtag pa'i phyogs nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the appearance of two moons and so on are devoid of external form that performs a function, and they are not established as entities.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i dmigs pa nyid yin pa bkag par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i dmigs pa nyid yin pa bkag par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: By this, the aggregates and so on are also understood to be negated as the focal object of the view of self, because they are undermined by the position of permanence.

original: 'og nas de dag gcig pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes kyang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og nas de dag gcig pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes kyang bshad par bya'o //
translated: It will be explained below that they are not tenable as the characteristics of sameness and so on.

original: da ni bdag la sogs pa med na ji ltar thams cad la 'di ni bdag go //
analyzed: da ni bdag la sogs pa med na ji ltar thams cad la 'di ni bdag go //
translated: Now, if there is no self and so on, how can the convention ‚ÄúThis is mine‚Äù be applied to all?

original: 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'jug / rnal 'byor pa zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa thob pa rnams kyis bdag gi zag pa zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo yang ji ltar rab tu 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'jug / rnal 'byor pa zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa thob pa rnams kyis bdag gi zag pa zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo yang ji ltar rab tu 'grub ce na /
translated: And how can the cognition ‚ÄúMy defilements are exhausted‚Äù and so on be established by yogis who have attained the knowledge of elimination and nonarising?

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: bdag la sogs pa dang ces can du lta ba la sogs par 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa dang ces can du lta ba la sogs par 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no connection between the view of self, etc. and the self, etc.

original: gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa rab tu grub pa de kho na de bsal na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba yin na bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang 'brel par yang ma grub po zhes pha la cher bstan zin to //
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa rab tu grub pa de kho na de bsal na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba yin na bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang 'brel par yang ma grub po zhes pha la cher bstan zin to //
translated: That which is established as connected to something else will not occur when that is refuted, but it has already been demonstrated that the view of self, etc. are not established as connected to the self, etc.

original: de skye ba la phung po la sogs par snang ba ma brtags gcig pu na dga' ba ni ji ltar mthong ba bzhin rgyu yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de skye ba la phung po la sogs par snang ba ma brtags gcig pu na dga' ba ni ji ltar mthong ba bzhin rgyu yin pa nyid do //
translated: The appearance of the aggregates, etc. in the arising of that is the cause of the mere pleasure of the uncritical person, just as it is seen.

original: de nyid la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de @123b dang de las dge slong dag gang du dag bdag go zhe'am bdag go'o zhes byang dag par rjes su lta ba de dag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag kho na la yangüîΩdag par rjes su lta'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de @123b dang de las dge slong dag gang du dag bdag go zhe'am bdag go'o zhes byang dag par rjes su lta ba de dag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag kho na la yangüîΩdag par rjes su lta'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: With that in mind, the Lord also said, ‚ÄúMonks, wherever there is the view of self or the view of being mine, it is only in these five acquisitive aggregates that the view of self or the view of being mine occurs.‚Äù

original: gal te phung po la sogs pa bdag la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin na de ji ltar bdag la sogs pa'i blo'i yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phung po la sogs pa bdag la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin na de ji ltar bdag la sogs pa'i blo'i yul yin zhe na /
translated: If the aggregates, etc. are not the nature of self, etc., how can they be the objects of the cognition of self, etc.?

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i blo'i yul med pas 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i blo'i yul med pas 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Because of that, the object of that cognition does not exist, and so it is erroneous.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: yul yod pa nyid gcig yin na shes pa thams cad la 'khrul pa dang cig shos kyi tha snyad mi 'thad do //
analyzed: yul yod pa nyid gcig yin na shes pa thams cad la 'khrul pa dang cig shos kyi tha snyad mi 'thad do //
translated: if the object did exist, it would not be tenable to call all cognitions either erroneous or nonerroneous.

original: gal te 'di 'khrul pa yin na ji ltar de kho na nyid mthong ba dag 'jug ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'di 'khrul pa yin na ji ltar de kho na nyid mthong ba dag 'jug ce na /
translated: If this is erroneous, how can those who see reality engage in it?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so,

original: de dag ni de'i mtshan nyid la kun tu rmongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de'i mtshan nyid la kun tu rmongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not confused about its characteristics.

original: ngo bo gzhan yongs su 'dzin par lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan yongs su 'dzin par lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas /
translated: In dependence on the adherence to the apprehension of another nature,

original: 'khrul par mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa dag 'khrul par rnam par gzhag gi rang gi ngo bo la ltos nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul par mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa dag 'khrul par rnam par gzhag gi rang gi ngo bo la ltos nas ni ma yin te /
translated: the cognitions that are asserted to be erroneous are posited as erroneous, but not in dependence on their own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyis rang la sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyis rang la sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is by the nature of things that one does not superimpose anything on oneself by experiencing things as they are.

original: de lta bas na rnal 'byor pa sems kyi 'jug pa mtha' dag rang gi rnam pa tsam yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan par lta ba rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'i tshe rgyu 'ga' zhig gis bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnamüîΩpar rtog pa 'jug pa la nyes pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnal 'byor pa sems kyi 'jug pa mtha' dag rang gi rnam pa tsam yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan par lta ba rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'i tshe rgyu 'ga' zhig gis bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa la nyes pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, even those yogins who see all mental activity as just one‚Äôs own mental activity do not have any fault when discursive thought occurs, because of some cause, such as the thought ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: gal te bdag la sogs pa 'di thams cad yang dag par med mod kyi 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par byed pa dang ldan pas byang chub mngon sum du bya dgos so //
analyzed: gal te bdag la sogs pa 'di thams cad yang dag par med mod kyi 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par byed pa dang ldan pas byang chub mngon sum du bya dgos so //
translated: If all of these, ‚ÄúI,‚Äù etc., are really nonexistent, still, the bodhisattva must realize enlightenment by being endowed with the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de mi dmigs pa na ni de goms pa yang mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa na ni de goms pa yang mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: If he does not apprehend them, then it is impossible for him to practice them.

original: de lta bas na de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par blta bar bya dgos pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par blta bar bya dgos pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it must be seen as the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zag la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du med na de dang 'brel pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang med pa'i phyir dang gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zag la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du med na de dang 'brel pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang med pa'i phyir dang gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: because if the bodhisattva does not exist as a self of the person, etc., the perfection of wisdom connected with him does not exist, and because it does not have the characteristics of the aspects of the apprehended, etc.

original: de goms pa ni de'i mtshan nyid la kun du rmongs pa med pa dang ldan pa rnams la kun rdzob tu 'ga' ba med pa kho na'o zhes phal cher bstan zin @124a * //
analyzed: de goms pa ni de'i mtshan nyid la kun du rmongs pa med pa dang ldan pa rnams la kun rdzob tu 'ga' ba med pa kho na'o zhes phal cher bstan zin @124a * //
translated: The cultivation of that is the possession of the absence of error with regard to its characteristics, and it is the conventional nonexistence of the bodhisattva who possesses it.

original: to ; / de lta bas na gnyen po de lta bu goms pa'i sgo nas mthong ba'i lam nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad dang 'gal ba 'dzin pa la sogs par rtog pas dben par mtshan nyid gcig pa yang dag par skyes na gang zag la sogs par rtogüîΩpa'i rgyun spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan nas /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i gdams ngag la gnas pa la thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mngon par 'phel ba'i thar ba'i chad dang mthun pa dag las rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi me'i snga ltas yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i chad
analyzed: to ; / de lta bas na gnyen po de lta bu goms pa'i sgo nas mthong ba'i lam nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad dang 'gal ba 'dzin pa la sogs par rtog pas dben par mtshan nyid gcig pa yang dag par skyes na gang zag la sogs par rtog pa'i rgyun spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan nas / byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i gdams ngag la gnas pa la thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mngon par 'phel ba'i thar ba'i chad dang mthun pa dag las rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi me'i snga ltas yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i chad
translated: Therefore, when the path of seeing, which is the antidote that is cultivated in that way, arises in a manner that is of one taste with the emptiness that is free from all the latent tendencies of the afflictions, the continuum of the conceptions of persons and so on will be abandoned.

original: dang mthun par dro bar gyur pa skye'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang mthun par dro bar gyur pa skye'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught that, in order to teach that the heat of the clear realization of the nonconceptual wisdom that is the precursor of the fire of the wisdom of the path of seeing arises in the bodhisattva who abides in the correct instructions through the stages of hearing and so on,üîΩthe text says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The bodhisattva who does not observe.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang la byang chub kyi sems smon pa dang 'jug pa'i bdag nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa dmigs shing mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang la byang chub kyi sems smon pa dang 'jug pa'i bdag nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa dmigs shing mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who does not objectify and does not settle down upon the thought of enlightenment, which is of the nature of aspiration and of entrance, as being different on account of the distinctions of impermanence, etc.

original: 'di ni mtshon par zad kyi snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs na dngos po thams cad brjod pa'i rjes su 'jug par rtog pas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i rnam pa thams cad la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshon par zad kyi snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs na dngos po thams cad brjod pa'i rjes su 'jug par rtog pas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i rnam pa thams cad la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is merely an illustration, for in the state of concentration which is the attainment of illumination, he does not settle down upon all the aspects of the aggregates of form, etc., because he has the idea that they all conform to verbal description.

original: 'di ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po chung ngus rab tu phye ba'i phyir dro bar gyur pa chung du yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po chung ngus rab tu phye ba'i phyir dro bar gyur pa chung du yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be regarded as the lesser of the heats, because it is distinguished by the lesser faith, etc.üîΩThe middling is

original: 'bring ni // de skad thos nas rmongs pa med cing mi skrag pa //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bring ni // de skad thos nas rmongs pa med cing mi skrag pa // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: When he hears this, he is neither confused nor frightened.

original: rmongs pa ni yang dag par ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa ni yang dag par ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: Confusion is the lack of understanding.

original: skrag pa ni 'jigs par lta ba nyid do //
analyzed: skrag pa ni 'jigs par lta ba nyid do //
translated: Fear is the very seeing of fear.

original: gang la de gnyis med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la de gnyis med pa ste /
translated: Where those two do not exist,

original: de kho na nyid tshad ma dang mi 'gal zhing 'tshe ba med pa dbang po 'bring po'i mos pas yul du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid tshad ma dang mi 'gal zhing 'tshe ba med pa dbang po 'bring po'i mos pas yul du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the faith of those of middling faculties, which is not contradicted by valid knowledge of reality and is not harmful.

original: chen po ni /
analyzed: chen po ni /
translated: The great is

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni bde gshegs shes rab spyod //üîΩces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni bde gshegs shes rab spyod // ces bya ba yin te /
translated: That bodhisattva practices the wisdom of the Sugata.

original: spyod ces bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa la mngon par zhen pa sel ba'i sgo nas yul du byed pa'o //
analyzed: spyod ces bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa la mngon par zhen pa sel ba'i sgo nas yul du byed pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúpractices‚Äù means that it is the object of the elimination of the adherence to arising and cessation.

original: bde gshegs shes rab ni gang zhig skye ba la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde gshegs shes rab ni gang zhig skye ba la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The wisdom of the Sugata is that which is the antidote to the adherence to arising and so on. This is the meaning.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i dro bar gyur ba las byang chub sems dpa'i dro bar gyur pa snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid khyad par bzhis khyad par du @124b 'phags par bstan te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i dro bar gyur ba las byang chub sems dpa'i dro bar gyur pa snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid khyad par bzhis khyad par du @124b 'phags par bstan te /
translated: Thus, this shows that the heat stage of the bodhisattva is superior to the heat stage of the sravakas, etc., by four characteristics of the meditative concentration that obtains the light of the stage of heat.

original: dmigs pa'i khyad par gyis ni dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i khyad par gyis ni dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The superiority of objective support refers to the objective support of all things in the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: rnam pa'i khyad par gyis ni brjod pa tsam du rtog pas de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par gyis ni brjod pa tsam du rtog pas de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The superiority of aspect refers to the aspect of the non-substantiality of the individual and the dharmas, because the bodhisattva is not attached to them through the concept that they are mere designations.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa dang rgyu nyid kyi khyad par dag ni bde bar gshegs pa la sogs pa thams cad kyis yongs su 'dzin pa dang byang chub gsum gyi rgyu rnam par dag pa'i ngo ba'i mtshan nyid 'og nas 'byung ba dag 'dir yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa dang rgyu nyid kyi khyad par dag ni bde bar gshegs pa la sogs pa thams cad kyis yongs su 'dzin pa dang byang chub gsum gyi rgyu rnam par dag pa'i ngo ba'i mtshan nyid 'og nas 'byung ba dag 'dir yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The superiority of possession and cause should be understood here as the possession by all the Sugatas, etc., and the pure nature of the cause of the three enlightenments, as will be described later.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i dro bar gyur ba ni phal cher phung po la sogs pa tsam la dmigs pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i rnam pa can dang / bde bar gshegs pa la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa tsam gyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i dro bar gyur ba ni phal cher phung po la sogs pa tsam la dmigs pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i rnam pa can dang / bde bar gshegs pa la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa tsam gyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The heat of sravakas and so on focuses mainly on mere aggregates and so on, has the aspect of comprehending impermanence and so on, is free from grasping the sugatas and so on and is the antidote to just the afflictions of oneself.

original: rang gi byang chub tsam gyi 'bras bu can yin te /
analyzed: rang gi byang chub tsam gyi 'bras bu can yin te /
translated: It has the result of just one's enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa lhag ma rnams la yang ci rigs par khyad par bzhis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa lhag ma rnams la yang ci rigs par khyad par bzhis shes par bya'o //
translated: The remaining factors conducive to penetrative insight should be understood in a similar way through the four differences.

original: de ltar re zhig gtso por gang zag la sogs pa'i dngos por rtog pa dngos su bsal nas gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por rtog pa bsal ba'i sgo nas dro bar gyu pa'i mjug thogs su rtse mor gyur pa snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gtso por gang zag la sogs pa'i dngos por rtog pa dngos su bsal nas gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por rtog pa bsal ba'i sgo nas dro bar gyu pa'i mjug thogs su rtse mor gyur pa snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo
translated: Thus, having explicitly eliminated the conception of things such as the person, the peak arises after heat and is the concentration of the increase of appearance.

original: bo nyid dbang po shin tu mchog tu gyur ba'i gnas skabs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bo nyid dbang po shin tu mchog tu gyur ba'i gnas skabs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach the stage of the bodhisattva's supreme faculties, he says,

original: gzugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pas yang dag par bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pas yang dag par bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Form, etc. are included in the Truths of Suffering and Origin.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni byang chub sems dpa' de la rten mo'i gnas skabs na gzugs la sogs par snang ba sems tsam gyi rnam pa nyid kyis rdul phrar ba la sogs pa'i gzugs mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can yang gnas te dmigs pa'i yul rdul
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni byang chub sems dpa' de la rten mo'i gnas skabs na gzugs la sogs par snang ba sems tsam gyi rnam pa nyid kyis rdul phrar ba la sogs pa'i gzugs mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can yang gnas te dmigs pa'i yul rdul
translated: The meaning of included is that the bodhisattva, in the stage of the ten levels, by the aspect of mind-only, is established in the appearance of form, etc. as impermanent, etc. in the aspect of atoms, etc. of form, etc.

original: tsam yang yod pa min pa'am mi snang ste de ni yang dag par na rigs pa dang lung gi sgo nas mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tsam yang yod pa min pa'am mi snang ste de ni yang dag par na rigs pa dang lung gi sgo nas mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: There is not even an atom of an objective realm, or it does not appear, because it is not tenable in reality by reason and scripture.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: Form, etc. are devoid of the nature of one and many,

original: 'di ltar de dag thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma la sogs pa'i bye brag gis yan lag du ma'i @125a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma la sogs pa'i bye brag gis yan lag du ma'i @125a * //
translated: Thus, they are not established as having parts, such as a beginning, middle, end, and so on.üîΩ

original: ngo bo nyid du snang ba'i phyir dang de las ma gtogs pa'i yan lag can la sogs pa gcig pu yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid gcig pa na yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du snang ba'i phyir dang de las ma gtogs pa'i yan lag can la sogs pa gcig pu yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid gcig pa na yin no //
translated: Thus, because it appears as the nature of many parts, such as beginning, middle, end, etc., and because a single possessor of parts, etc., apart from those is not perceived, it is not a single nature.

original: 'on te dmigs pa na ni yan lag du ma las ma gtogs pa'i gcig pu rang gi bdag nyid tsam du gnas pa'i phyir du ma nyid nyams pa med do //
analyzed: 'on te dmigs pa na ni yan lag du ma las ma gtogs pa'i gcig pu rang gi bdag nyid tsam du gnas pa'i phyir du ma nyid nyams pa med do //
translated: But if it is perceived, then the loss of its multiplicity is not entailed, because it abides as a mere single nature of its own, apart from its many parts.

original: phan tshun 'dres pa med pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i du ma ni gcig tu 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun 'dres pa med pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i du ma ni gcig tu 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: A multiplicity that appears as a nature not mixed with each other is not fit to become a single thing,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang gcig 'gyur na yang thams cad 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang gcig 'gyur na yang thams cad 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences, and because if one were to become one, all would become one.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas kyang de gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas kyang de gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: It is not established as a single thing even by way of inference.

original: sngon po la sogs pa phan tshun yan lag tha dad pa'i bdag nyid du snang ba la de'i gcig pa nyid mngon dum gyis gzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa phan tshun yan lag tha dad pa'i bdag nyid du snang ba la de'i gcig pa nyid mngon dum gyis gzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the appearance of the different parts of the blue, etc., is not established by the perception of their unity.

original: yan lag las ma gtogs pa'i yan lag can zhig rab tu grub par rtog na ni du ma nyid nyams pa med do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: yan lag las ma gtogs pa'i yan lag can zhig rab tu grub par rtog na ni du ma nyid nyams pa med do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: If one imagines that the possessor of the parts is established apart from the parts, then the fault of multiplicity is not avoided. This has been explained.

original: ri'i glo la 'jug pa'i me rjes su dpag pas rab tu grub pa'i phyir ri'i bdag nyid med snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ri'i glo la 'jug pa'i me rjes su dpag pas rab tu grub pa'i phyir ri'i bdag nyid med snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The appearance of the mountain is not the appearance of something that does not exist as a mountain, because it is established by the inference of the fire on the mountain.

original: de ma yin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it appears in a way that is not that.

original: yan lag can mngon sum ma yin pa dang 'brel ba rab tu grub pa'i rtags kyang cung zad kyang med la rtags dang rtags can 'brel ba rtogs pa med par yang rjes su dpag ba mi 'jug pa'i phyir ri'i bdag nyid du snang ba ni ma yin te
analyzed: yan lag can mngon sum ma yin pa dang 'brel ba rab tu grub pa'i rtags kyang cung zad kyang med la rtags dang rtags can 'brel ba rtogs pa med par yang rjes su dpag ba mi 'jug pa'i phyir ri'i bdag nyid du snang ba ni ma yin te
translated: There is not the slightest proof of the establishment of the connection of the non-perception of the possessor of the parts, and because inference does not operate without the understanding of the connection between the mark and the marked, the appearance as the nature of the mountain is not the appearance of something that does not exist as a mountain.

original: / de ma yin pa'i rnams par snang ba dag la yang 'jug pa'i phyir 'khrul ba yin no //
analyzed: / de ma yin pa'i rnams par snang ba dag la yang 'jug pa'i phyir 'khrul ba yin no //
translated: and it is also mistaken with regard to the appearances of things that are not one.

original: de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yang sngon po la sogs pa de dag nyid yin te /
analyzed: de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yang sngon po la sogs pa de dag nyid yin te /
translated: The cause of its arising is those very blue things, etc.

original: de mthong ba nyid la tha dad pa ma yin pa'i blo skye ba'i phyir dang de las gzhan pa'i gcig pu'i ngo bo yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mthong ba nyid la tha dad pa ma yin pa'i blo skye ba'i phyir dang de las gzhan pa'i gcig pu'i ngo bo yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition of them arises as if it were not different from the seeing of them, and because one sees them as having a single nature, which is different from that.

original: gal te 'on sngon po la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab bsags pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'on sngon po la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab bsags pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the aggregation of subtle atoms of blue, etc. is the cause of the arising of the cognition of blue, etc.,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

analyzed: 'brel pa'i sgo nas ni su'i yin zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin te /

original: de dang 'brel pa'i bdag la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i bdag la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //

original: yul gyi sgo nas ni /üîΩgang las yin zhes chos 'di thams cad stong bar rtog //
analyzed: yul gyi sgo nas ni / gang las yin zhes chos 'di thams cad stong bar rtog //

analyzed: ces bya ba gang gsungs pa yin te /

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid kyi chos thams cad chos dang chos can gyi dngos po dang de stong pa nyid du yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //

original: rtog ces bya ba ni dpyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtog ces bya ba ni dpyod par byed pa'o //

analyzed: zhum pa med cing zhes bya ba ni thams cad sems tsam du rtogs pa'i phyir kun tu rmongs par mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //

original: de ltar rim gyis 'phel ba'i rtse mor gyur pa las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bzod pa de kho na nyid kyi phyogs gcig gis ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid dag skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ston cing gzugs la sogs pa'i
analyzed: de ltar rim gyis 'phel ba'i rtse mor gyur pa las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bzod pa de kho na nyid kyi phyogs gcig gis ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid dag skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ston cing gzugs la sogs pa'i
translated: Thus, at the peak of the gradual increase, the patience that is characterized by the realization of the absence of apprehended object and apprehending subject arises, and it is the nature of meditative stabilization that is partial to reality.

analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log gi ngo bo nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: etc.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni brgya la'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni brgya la'o //

analyzed: mi shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni @127b gzod ma nas skye ba med pa'i don khong du ma chung par ro //

analyzed: rtog ces bya ba ni gal te phung po dag la stong pa nyid du gzung ba'i bdag nyid du rtog par byed na yang ngo //

original: mtshan ma la zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma la ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma la zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma la ste /

analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: skye ba med pa nyid sgrib pa'i bag chags thams cad spong ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir gnas yin no //
translated: The non-arising of things is the basis for the elimination of all the instinctual propensities that obscure the non-arising of things. It is a basis because it is the basis for the elimination of all the instinctual propensities that obscure the non-arising of things.

original: de la ma dad pa ni ma mos pa ste /
analyzed: de la ma dad pa ni ma mos pa ste /

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni lhag ma yin no //

analyzed: phyin ci log 'di'i gnyen por phyin ci ma log pa bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gang zhig gzugs min tshor min zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, That which is neither form, nor feeling, nor perception, nor impulse, nor consciousness.

analyzed: sems pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi phung po thams cad nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sems pa'i tshogs drug ste zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: mi spyod ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral bar rtogs pa'i phyir te 'di ni bzod pa chung ngu yin no // gnas pa med par spyod ces bya ba ni rten pa med par spyod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not engage‚Äù means that one realizes that form and so on are devoid of the nature of entities, that is, the nature of apprehended objects, because they are the aspects of the nonexistence of entities such as form. This is lesser patience.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid kyi chos rnams ma skyes par nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid kyi chos rnams ma skyes par nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne engages without abiding‚Äù means one engages without support, because it is not tenable that phenomena that are by nature afflicted and purified arise in order to be released.

original: ma skyes pa ni yang dag par na gang gis na de la brten nas dpyod par 'gyur ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba sgrub par mi byed de 'di ni bzod pa 'brang yin no //

original: de ni spyod pa med na de dang ldan pa'i byed pa po yang spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs pas spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par byed pa po mtshan ma mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de ni spyod pa med na de dang ldan pa'i byed pa po yang spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs pas spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par byed pa po mtshan ma mi dmigs te /
translated: If there is no activity, then the agent who possesses it is not observed to be active. Thus, the agent is not observed to have activity, etc.

original: gzugs las sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa thams cad du med na chos thams cad gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyid kyis byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩbyed pa @128a * //
analyzed: gzugs las sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa thams cad du med na chos thams cad gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyid kyis byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // byed pa @128a * //
translated: If the signs of form, etc., do not exist in any way, then all things are not the nature of the apprehended, because there is no agent. This is the meaning.

original: po med du zin kyang 'on kyang ci'i phyir so so'i skye bo bzhin du der mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: po med du zin kyang 'on kyang ci'i phyir so so'i skye bo bzhin du der mi dmigs she na /

original: de ltar shes rab bstan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab bstan zhes bya ba smos te /

original: shes rab kyi mtshan ma thams cad kyis mi g-yos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mtshan ma thams cad kyis mi g-yos pa'i phyir ro //

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to clarify that, he says:

original: skye med blo ldan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skye med blo ldan zhes bya ba smos te /

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir de bzod pa chen po'i dbang gis chos thams cad skye ba med par mos pa de'i phyir de mtshan ma de dag mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir de bzod pa chen po'i dbang gis chos thams cad skye ba med par mos pa de'i phyir de mtshan ma de dag mi dmigs te /

analyzed: 'di nu bzod pa chen po yin no //

original: de ltar rim gyis bzod pa chen po thob pa'i rjes la bar chad med par mthong ba'i lam thob pa yin pa'i phyir bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdus pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs kyi ting nge 'dzin zhi ba mchog la reg ces byaüîΩba smos te /

translated: Thus, after gradually attaining great patience, he attains the uninterrupted path of seeing, and therefore he touches the supreme state of meditative stabilization, which is included in the uninterrupted meditative stabilization, and is called ‚Äúthe supreme meditative stabilization of peace.‚Äù

original: de la dge ba rtse gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin dag ste /
analyzed: de la dge ba rtse gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin dag ste /

analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: 'dzin pa'i g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir zhi ba dag go //

analyzed: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mchog dag go //

analyzed: 'di dag ni chos kyi mchog chung du yin no //

original: 'bring bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bring bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: byang chub sems gang de ltar 'dir bdag zhir gnas pa //

analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bdag nu mnyam par gzhag ce'am langs zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: 'di las langs na yang mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir gtan med par bstan pa yin no //

original: ci'i phyir na ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na ste /

translated: because the distinctions of the dharma of form, etc., as objects of meditation and the meditator, etc., do not exist in reality, and because at the stage of the supreme mundane right view, that resolve is perfected to its ultimate degree.

translated: If one were to say: ‚ÄúHow can it be the obstacle to definite emergence? analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa snang ba tsam du zad na de ji ltar na de la bdag la sogs pa 'dzin pa nyid du shes snyam du dogs pa'i skabs 'dzin par rtog pa dag po rab tu bstan pa'i sgo nas bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: To dispel this doubt, he says:

original: gang 'dir phung po lnga dag sgyu ma 'drar shes shing //
analyzed: gang 'dir phung po lnga dag sgyu ma 'drar shes shing //
translated: Here, the five aggregates are known to be like illusions,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: 'di skad du gang zag rnam pa thams cad du sngar bkag pa'i phyir dang phung po rnams kyang rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas 'di dag sgyu ma dang 'dra ba kho nar shes par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang zag rnam pa thams cad du sngar bkag pa'i phyir dang phung po rnams kyang rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas 'di dag sgyu ma dang 'dra ba kho nar shes par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is to say: since the person is completely refuted earlier and the aggregates are devoid of intrinsic identity, the bodhisattva should know them to be just like illusions.

original: sgyu ma smos pa ni yod pa ma yin pa las snang ba nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma smos pa ni yod pa ma yin pa las snang ba nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The mention of illusions illustrates the appearance of what is not existent.

original: ji ste gal te de dag sgyu ma dang 'dra ba yin ba 'o na ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis med pa las snang ba'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ste gal te de dag sgyu ma dang 'dra ba yin ba 'o na ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis med pa las snang ba'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: If you say that they are like illusions, then they are not the appearance of what does not exist in any way.

original: 'dra ba'i gzhi ni cung zad cig tha dad do zhe na /üîΩsgyu ma gzhan dang phung po gzhan du mi byed la //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i gzhi ni cung zad cig tha dad do zhe na / sgyu ma gzhan dang phung po gzhan du mi byed la //
translated: The basis of the comparison is a little different.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe illusion is not made into another, nor are the aggregates.‚Äù

original: phung po la sogs pa dang / sgyu ma ni gcig tu 'khrul pa'i bdag nyid du tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa dang / sgyu ma ni gcig tu 'khrul pa'i bdag nyid du tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aggregates, etc., and the illusion are not different in being the identity of error.

original: dper smos pa ni 'jig rten na grags pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //üîΩbdag ces bya ba la sogs par brtags pa tsam 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'dod pa dngos por yod do snyam @131a * //
analyzed: dper smos pa ni 'jig rten na grags pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no // bdag ces bya ba la sogs par brtags pa tsam 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'dod pa dngos por yod do snyam @131a * //
translated: The intention is that the example is based on what is known in the world.

original: du sems pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i sgo nas bsal ba'i phyir sna tshogs 'du shes bral zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: du sems pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i sgo nas bsal ba'i phyir sna tshogs 'du shes bral zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúFree from the perception of variety,‚Äù etc., in order to dispel the two kinds of conceptualization that grasp the object, thinking that the mere designation ‚Äúself,‚Äù etc., is the existent entity, and that the aspect of grasping is the existent entity.

original: sna tshogs nyid kyi 'du shes ni bdag la sogs pa rnam pa mang por 'dogs pa ste de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs nyid kyi 'du shes ni bdag la sogs pa rnam pa mang por 'dogs pa ste de dang bral ba'o //
translated: The notion of variety is the imputation of many aspects such as self, etc.

original: gzung ba med na de 'dzin pa mi 'thad pas de tsam la yang 'dzin pa'i rnam par mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te /üîΩsems tsam brten nas phyi rol ni //
analyzed: gzung ba med na de 'dzin pa mi 'thad pas de tsam la yang 'dzin pa'i rnam par mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te / sems tsam brten nas phyi rol ni //
translated: Since the absence of an object is not tenable, one should not cling to the notion of the apprehending subject in regard to that mere object.

original: ngo bo nyid med shes par bya //üîΩde bzhin nyid ni dmigs nas su //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med shes par bya // de bzhin nyid ni dmigs nas su //

original: sems tsam las ni bzla bar bya //üîΩzhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems tsam las ni bzla bar bya // zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Having perceived reality, one should transcend mind only.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log med pas nye bar zhi bar spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log med pas nye bar zhi bar spyod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since there is no error, one acts with tranquility.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni phung po 'khrul pa tsam du rab tu bstan pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni phung po 'khrul pa tsam du rab tu bstan pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid bshad pa yin te /

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rigs par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood in regard to the other perfections.

original: ji tsam du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la ltos nas dngos po'i sgo nas bstan pa de thams cad ni kun brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la ltos nas dngos po'i sgo nas bstan pa de thams cad ni kun brtags pa yin no //

original: gang zhig de ltar mos par dka' ba'i shes rab bstan pa la skrag par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar mos par dka' ba'i shes rab bstan pa la skrag par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Will one who is thus inclined not be afraid of the teaching of the wisdom that is difficult to realize?

original: dge ba'i bshes dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúEndowed with a spiritual teacher . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dis ni rgyu gnyis kyis na 'jigs pa med par bshad de /
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu gnyis kyis na 'jigs pa med par bshad de /
translated: This explains that fearlessness is due to two causes.

original: rten gyi stobs kyis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gyi stobs kyis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The power of support is due to being endowed with a spiritual teacher.

original: rang gi shes kyi stobs kyis ni lhag mthong dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi shes kyi stobs kyis ni lhag mthong dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The power of one‚Äôs own knowledge is due to being endowed with insight.

original: shes rab 'chal pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa ni don cung zad kyang rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa ni don cung zad kyang rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is devoid of wisdom and encounters a spiritual teacher will not develop even a little understanding.

original: bzlog pa skrag pa'i rgyu /
analyzed: bzlog pa skrag pa'i rgyu /
translated: The causes of fear are the opposite of those.

original: gang zhig sdig pa'i grogs ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig sdig pa'i grogs ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúEndowed with evil friends . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan gyi dring 'jog pa ni blo zhan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring 'jog pa ni blo zhan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the other is dependent on the intellect.

original: de nyid gzhan dag gis tshoms par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan dag gis tshoms par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: because the other is dependent on the intellect.

original: snod so ma btang chus reg zhig pa bzhin te /
analyzed: snod so ma btang chus reg zhig pa bzhin te /
translated: like a pot that has not been fired, which is destroyed by contact with water.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du yongs su gzung ba smos pa khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du yongs su gzung ba smos pa khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the term ‚Äúgrasping‚Äù refers to all the stages of the aids to penetration.

original: gang zag la sogs pa med na ji ltar 'di de dang de las byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar tha snyad 'dogs she na /
analyzed: gang zag la sogs pa med na ji ltar 'di de dang de las byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar tha snyad 'dogs she na /
translated: If there is no person, etc., how can this be called a bodhisattva in this and that stage?

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs @131b pa smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs @131b pa smos so //
translated: Why?

original: yang na ci zhes bya ba'i sgra ni spong ba'i don yin pa'i phyir de ltar gzugs la sogs pa med na tha snyad 'di rgyu med pa can yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na ci zhes bya ba'i sgra ni spong ba'i don yin pa'i phyir de ltar gzugs la sogs pa med na tha snyad 'di rgyu med pa can yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúwhat‚Äù has the sense of rejection, so it is saying that if form, etc., do not exist, this conventional expression is groundless.

original: kun rdzob tu 'jug go zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig lhur bya ba'i don yin par zad de /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu 'jug go zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig lhur bya ba'i don yin par zad de /
translated: The point is that one should not be so intent on the expression ‚Äúin reality‚Äù that one neglects the expression ‚Äúconventionally.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni tshig gi don med pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni tshig gi don med pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, the meaning of the word ‚Äúbodhisattva‚Äù is the meaning of a non-meaning.

original: de la tha snyad 'di'i rgyu mtshan khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la tha snyad 'di'i rgyu mtshan khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the special reason for this convention,

original: kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn all,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa thams cad la chags pa zad pa ni rnam par rtog pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa thams cad la chags pa zad pa ni rnam par rtog pa spong ba'o //
translated: The exhaustion of attachment to all such things as form is the elimination of conceptualization.

original: ci'i phyir der 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir der 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is that so?

original: 'di ltar chags pa gcod byed de rtog pa mtha' dag sel ba'i ngang tshul can yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chags pa gcod byed de rtog pa mtha' dag sel ba'i ngang tshul can yin te /
translated: Because it is the nature of the elimination of all attachment, and it is the nature of the elimination of all conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i ming 'thob po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i ming 'thob po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is connected with the statement, ‚ÄúThis is how one obtains the name ‚Äòbodhisattva.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: 'di skad du phung po la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral bar mtshungs mod kyi phung po'i rgyun gang zhig bshad pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa sgrub pa rim gyis sgrib pa thams
analyzed: 'di skad du phung po la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral bar mtshungs mod kyi phung po'i rgyun gang zhig bshad pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa sgrub pa rim gyis sgrib pa thams
translated: It is said that although the aggregates and so on are similar in being free from the aspects of grasping and so on, the continuum of the aggregates that is established through the stages of practice such as the factors conducive to penetrative insight explained and to be explained is free from the obscurations of the three realms.

original: cad spong ba'i rgyu yin pa de kho na byang chub sems dpar tha snyad gdags pa'i yul yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: cad spong ba'i rgyu yin pa de kho na byang chub sems dpar tha snyad gdags pa'i yul yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is said that although the bodhisattva and the person are the same in being free from the aspects of grasping such as the aggregates, only the continuum of aggregates that is the cause for abandoning all obscurations through gradually accomplishing the factors conducive to penetrative insight and so on is the object of the convention of bodhisattva, not others.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni sgrub pa'i gzhi chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi rigs bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni sgrub pa'i gzhi chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi rigs bshad pa yin te /
translated: Thus this passage explains the potential that is the basis of the practice, the nature of the dharmadhatu.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i skabs thun mong ma yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs kyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i skabs thun mong ma yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs kyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is taught that the bodhisattvas are distinguished by their potential because this uncommon context of the factors conducive to penetrative insight and so on is distinguished by their potential.

original: sgrub pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the object of the practice,

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi byang chub chags med gyur la reg //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi byang chub chags med gyur la reg //
translated: The Victors' enlightenment is unattached.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin gyi rigs dang ldan pa'i go cha la sogs pa'i sgrub pa'i dmigs pa ni gtsor na rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i byang chub yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin gyi rigs dang ldan pa'i go cha la sogs pa'i sgrub pa'i dmigs pa ni gtsor na rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i byang chub yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The objective supports of the armor and so on of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the natural lineage are primarily the enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

analyzed: chags med gyur zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i byang chub ces bya bar sbyar ro //

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: byang chub sems dpar tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu'i thabs kyi dmigs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu'i thabs kyi dmigs pa bshad zin to //
translated: This completes the explanation of the objective supports of the means that are the causes for the designation of bodhisattva.üîΩThe objective supports of the greatüîΩThe objective supports of the great

original: sems dpa' che zhes bya ba la sogs pa @132a * //
analyzed: sems dpa' che zhes bya ba la sogs pa @132a * //
translated: are the great, the exceedingly difficult,üîΩand the long-lasting.

analyzed: 'byung ba de la byang chub la dmigs pa'i sgrub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen por bstan pa'i rgyu che ba'i bdag nyid kyi ched ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The objective supports of the great

analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid ni /
translated: are the great, the exceedingly difficult,üîΩand the long-lasting.

analyzed: sems can tshogs rnams mang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe great multitude of sentient beings‚Äù and so on occurs.

analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi tshogs mang po tshad med pa sems can gyi tshogs rab tu dbye ba dpag tu med pa'i mchog phul du byung bar gyur ba yin te /
translated: This is the supreme, most excellent, immeasurable multitude of sentient beings, the multitude of sentient beings that is classified as immeasurable.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir smon lam yongs su btab pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir smon lam yongs su btab pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva thinks, ‚ÄúI have made this aspiration prayer in order to protect the entire world.‚Äù

translated: The nature of great abandonment is the cutting off of all the forms of the view of self in the realm of sentient beings, such as the gods‚Äô view of permanence, and so on.

analyzed: rtogs pa che ba'i bdag nyid ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /

analyzed: dngos sum ma gsungs kyang shugs kyis khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Although it is not explicitly stated, it should be understood by implication.

analyzed: de lta bu ni sgrub pa'i ched yin te /

translated: because the aim is established as the entity of the state in which the result of that practice will occur, while the object is the entity that is simultaneous with the practice.

translated: the practice of armor, the practice of engagement, the practice of the collections, and the practice of definite emergence.

original: de la go cha ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la go cha ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The armor is to be known as sixfold.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha ni /
translated: The armor of the perfection of giving is

analyzed: gtong ba che zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /

analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad gtong ba'i bsam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha ni /
translated: The armor of the perfection of morality is

analyzed: blo che zhes bya ba yin te /

original: rang dang gzhan la brten pa'i 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnyen po'i bsam pa can yin pa nyid kyis blo rgya @132b che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la brten pa'i 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnyen po'i bsam pa can yin pa nyid kyis blo rgya @132b che ba'i phyir ro //

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams pa bzhi'i go cha ni /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams pa bzhi'i go cha ni /
translated: The armor of the four perfections beginning with patience is

analyzed: mthu che zhes bya ba yin te /

original: gzhan gyi gnod pa dang / dka' ba byed pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba nyid dang / de kho na la ma mos pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i bsam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: It is the intention not to be overcome by the harmfulness of others, by difficulties, by distraction, and by lack of interest in reality.

original: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid ni /üîΩtheg pa ched zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid ni / theg pa ched zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin te /

analyzed: theg pa chen po ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pa byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //

analyzed: de la zhugs pa ni de la sbyor ba byas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig go //

analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba byas pa ni tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed de de'i phyir zhi gnas kyi tshogs go cha chen po bgos zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad kyis mi 'khrugs pa'i bsam pa can yin pa'i phyir go cha chen po bgos pa'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //

original: de nyid kyi mthu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi mthu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the power of that, it says,

original: bdud kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: rtse gcig pa'i yid dang ldan pas ni bdud thams cad zil gyis mnan par nus pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' la sems dpa' chen po zhes tha snyad du gdags pas ;
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva is designated by the conventional term ‚Äúgreat being.‚Äù

original: / sems dpa' che zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: / sems dpa' che zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

original: de ji ltar phyin ci la logs pa 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar phyin ci la logs pa 'gyur zhe na /

original: sgyu ma mkhan zhes byas ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan zhes byas ba la sogs pa smos so //

original: sgyu ma mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de sprul pa dag la kun tu rmongs pa pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de sprul pa dag la kun tu rmongs pa pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bzhi mdo zhes bya ba smos pa ni sems can mang po kun du rmongs pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gsad bya de dag ci 'dra zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma byas pa'i gsad par bya ba de dag ji lta bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: 'gro kun zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba sprul pa dang 'dra bar shes zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: ji skad du / ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan kho nas sgyu ma byas pa 'khrul pa tsham nyid du shes kyi de la kun du rmongs pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan gyis ni ma ma yin pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa kho
translated: As it is said:

analyzed: nas sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa 'gro ba mtha' dag sprul pa lta bur shes so zhes bshad par @133a * //

original: 'gyur te / byang chub sems dpa'i lhag mthong gi tshogs thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur te / byang chub sems dpa'i lhag mthong gi tshogs thun mong ma yin pa yin no //

original: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúform, etc.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: yod pa min zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: yod pa min zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /

analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas med pa la bcing pa dang thar pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
